children.subject: Nope, you'll have to take a true graduate course.
Is 289 a different class from 189? What’s a true graduate class?

It's the exact same class, just crosslisted, which is why I was wondering if it could be backdated as detailed here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/academics/graduate/industry-programs/5yrms/policies

guess it can't, though. rip

It's not the exact same class; 289 has a grad project that 189 doesn't. Maybe you could try getting credit if you do the project, but there's no guarantee that's even allowed. Either way, the classes are not identical
Also, if I'm taking 189 next semester, can I get it backdated to receive graduate (289) credit?

Another thing for the acceptance rate, just from talking around it seems like having a good GPA plus a faculty member who is willing to sponsor makes it seem like you have a really good chance of getting in!

Also letter of rec wise - you should be able to get a good one from your faculty sponsor/person you do research with (I am assuming they are same person?) so you should be fine if the other ones aren't like amazing
Getting the professor to sign off is a good idea, thanks
You're welcome! Best of luck with the application.

One thing to note, the instructor who is a PhD student probably has a good relationship with a professor you kinda know from TAing, so you can ask for the PhD student to write the letter but the Professor do any last edits and have it be in his/her name.

Current 5th year, at the new grad student orientation, acceptance rate is about 70% with a 90% yield rate (basically students who do 5th year are very self-selective).

I believe they say the most important thing is if a professor is willing to sponsor you, which requires his or her letter of rec.

history.content:
Sorry for asking in the undergrad Piazza, but does anyone know how admissions treats a PhD student's letter of rec? I was a TA when they taught a course over the summer, so I know them pretty well and think they could write me a better letter than some of the faculty I know less well.

Also, is the acceptance rate for the program still ~50%? My GPA is 3.98ish and I've done undergrad research, but I'm not so confident in my letters of rec...
history.subject: 5th year MS letters of rec
